examples: The faceplate is turned rather than cast.
I killed a rather good bottle of Fleurie.
I found her story rather hard to swallow.
The manager struck a rather insincere note as he expressed his sorrow at the round of layoffs.
The company opted for a settlement rather than taking their former employee to court.
words.defineEn: ‌used as a positive response to a suggestion or question
words.defineVi: ‌được sử dụng như một phản hồi tích cực cho một gợi ý hoặc câu hỏi

examples: The board of directors of the company was composed entirely of men in gray suits who were resistant to change and innovation, and who were not receptive to new ideas or perspectives.
And they're more receptive to ride-sharing.
And at least in the private markets, investors have been fairly receptive to this model.
Netanyahu was not terribly receptive.
Now most female mammals become sexually receptive when their estrogens peak during ovulation, but it doesn't really work that way for humans.
words.defineEn: being open to listening or considering suggestions and new ideas
words.defineVi: cởi mở để lắng nghe hoặc xem xét các đề xuất và ý tưởng mới

examples: There’s actually research showing that the receptiveness and responsiveness of whoever’s listening to your self-disclosures is really important.
words.defineEn: the quality of being open to new ideas and suggestions
words.defineVi: chất lượng cởi mở với những ý tưởng và đề xuất mới

examples: That means multiples generally occur before the suppression of ovulation, the decrease in uterine receptivity, and the formation of the mucus plug.
I think it gets confusing for women because possibly that submissive receptivity is kind of gone.

Basically, the doctors thought it may have pressed pause on its development and hung around in the uterus for a few weeks before implanting, getting in just under the wire in terms of uterine receptivity.
But you really having fully cultivated the capacity of receptivity, of learning how to listen.
I can still sing it with as much conviction, perhaps even more, based on the fact that I think there's more receptivity to some of the topics that I dive into when I write.
words.defineEn: the quality of being able or inclined to accept new ideas, suggestions, or perspectives
words.defineVi: chất lượng của việc có thể hoặc có xu hướng chấp nhận những ý tưởng, đề xuất hoặc quan điểm mới

examples: Well, Mueller in the report gave us a little road map.
Former FDA Commissioner Dr. Mark McClellan has been working on a major road map to gradually reignite the economy.
I certainly think one road map is, again, our infrastructure report card.
I was just thinking, a treatment plan is really like a road map.
I gave them a road map anda flashlight to find a fraud, and they didn't go where I toldthem to go.
words.defineEn: a thorough plan devised to aid progress toward a goal
words.defineVi: một kế hoạch kỹ lưỡng được nghĩ ra để hỗ trợ tiến độ hướng tới một mục tiêu

examples: The incident says an awful lot about his character.
The clock says ten past two.
His angry glance said it all.
To say a prayer.
The clock said three o'clock.
words.defineEn: to suggest an example or assume something to be the case
words.defineVi: để đề xuất một ví dụ hoặc giả định một cái gì đó là trường hợp

examples: The incident says an awful lot about his character.
The clock says ten past two.
His angry glance said it all.
To say a prayer.
The clock said three o'clock.
words.defineEn: ‌used to draw someone's attention to one's remark or comment
words.defineVi: Được sử dụng để thu hút sự chú ý của ai đó đến nhận xét hoặc nhận xét của một người

examples: A slate fell off the roof and missed the child by a hair's breadth.
Despite their previous failures, the team wiped the slate clean and came back stronger than ever.
We decided to wipe the slate clean and move on.
I want to wipe the slate clean and start over with you.
I'm getting slate.
words.defineEn: to anoint someone for a particular job, position, etc.
words.defineVi: để xức dầu cho ai đó cho một công việc cụ thể, vị trí, vv

examples: The student submitted her term paper early, beating her classmates to the punch and impressing her professor with her diligence and quality of work.
The conference organizers requested that all presenters submit an abstract of their research papers.
They explained the procedure for submitting the application form.
The writer hoped to hitch her wagon to a star by submitting her manuscript to a top publishing house.
Ibrahim Magu, became a law unto himself and refused to submit to constituted authority.
words.defineEn: to formally present a proposal, document, etc. to someone of an authority for further consideration or final verdict
words.defineVi: để chính thức trình bày một đề xuất, tài liệu, v.v. cho ai đó có thẩm quyền để xem xét thêm hoặc phán quyết cuối cùng

examples: When the company had already lost a major client, the sales team suggested a new strategy.
An engineer suggested driving a tunnel through the Judean hills.
Recent economic performance suggests that a major crisis is at hand.
I suggest you wear another for today.
That last game suggests that we have been getting ahead of ourselves in praising the team's progress.
words.defineEn: to mention or put forward an idea, proposition, plan, etc. for further consideration or possible action
words.defineVi: để đề cập hoặc đưa ra một ý tưởng, đề xuất, kế hoạch, vv để xem xét thêm hoặc hành động có thể

examples: The new tech startup seemed like a sure thing, but it turned out to be a flash in the pan.
The stock market wasn't a sure thing.
But nothing is ever a sure thing.
But that’s not a sure thing.
It’s another case of the sure thing principle.
words.defineEn: used as a positive respond to something; something definite
words.defineVi: được sử dụng như một phản ứng tích cực với một cái gì đó; một cái gì đó xác định

examples: For many years, that tacit agreement with the Russian people held.
You have a president of the United States who is willing to give tacit approval to some of the darkest elements of American politics.
MILES O'BRIEN: In Reza Sayah's final report tomorrow, he will look at the tacit partnership between the U.S. and Iran to defeat ISIS in Iraq, and where that common goal ends.
words.defineEn: suggested or understood without being verbally expressed
words.defineVi: gợi ý hoặc hiểu mà không được thể hiện bằng lời nói

examples: It's been sort of tacitly allowed by the league and in many cases encouraged by the teams.
words.defineEn: understood or implied without expressing directly
words.defineVi: hiểu hoặc ngụ ý mà không diễn đạt trực tiếp

words.defineEn: ‌to begin to understand or accept an idea, suggestion, or problem
words.defineVi: ‌để bắt đầu hiểu hoặc chấp nhận một ý tưởng, gợi ý hoặc vấn đề

examples: Thales theorized that everything in the world is made of water.
Others theorize the heart shape is connected to Silphium.
Finally, another model theorizes that a nearly identical object to Earth collided with our young planet.
Obviously like everything in psychology, it's theorized.
In the 17th century, Johannes Kepler theorized cosmic musical harmonies to explain the nature of planetary orbits.
words.defineEn: to form a supposition about something, especially to justify a decision or a course of action
words.defineVi: để hình thành một giả định về một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là để biện minh cho một quyết định hoặc một quá trình hành động

words.defineEn: the act or process of forming or presenting facts and ideas about something
words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình hình thành hoặc trình bày các sự kiện và ý tưởng về một cái gì đó

examples: The volunteers worked together to collect donations for the local food drive.
The volunteers' organizing of the charity event was a labour of love.
She volunteers at the town library to help with organizing books.
I volunteer at the preschool to help with art activities and storytime.
Jake actually volunteered to do the dishes after dinner?
words.defineEn: to state or suggest something without being asked or told
words.defineVi: để nhà nước hoặc đề nghị một cái gì đó mà không được yêu cầu hoặc nói

words.defineEn: used for making a suggestion
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để đưa ra một đề nghị

words.defineEn: used to say that the matter that was being talked about should be done without hesitation because there is no reason to delay it any longer
words.defineVi: thường nói rằng vấn đề đang được nói đến nên được thực hiện không do dự vì không có lý do gì để trì hoãn nữa

words.defineEn: used to present a suggestion or an alternative
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để trình bày một gợi ý hoặc một thay thế

words.defineEn: used to say that even if the happening of something is unlikely, it is not impossible
words.defineVi: dùng để nói rằng ngay cả khi điều gì đó khó xảy ra thì cũng không phải là không thể xảy ra

examples: You said it, Conan, you're the king.
You said it, I didn't.
You said it, I didn't.
You said it, buddy. - Really wish I wouldn't have said that.
Oh, that's so much less impressive, now that you said it.
words.defineEn: said to express agreement with someone's suggestion
words.defineVi: nói để bày tỏ sự đồng ý với đề nghị của ai đó
